org.eclipse.gef4.fx.gestures

Class AbstractGesture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.fx.gestures.AbstractGesture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractMouseDragGesture, AbstractPinchSpreadGesture, AbstractRotateGesture, AbstractScrollGesture

    public abstract class AbstractGesture
extends java.lang.Object
    The AbstractGesture is the base class for all gestures defined within GEF4 FX. It manages the (un-)registration of event listeners based on the availability of a JavaFX Scene.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      AbstractGesture()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractGesture

        public AbstractGesture()

    • Method Detail

      • getScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        The Scene on which this gesture is registered.
        Returns:
        The Scene on which this gesture is registered.

      • register

        protected abstract void register()
        Called when a Scene is provided. The new Scene can be obtained via getScene(). Event handlers are registered here.

      • setScene

        public void setScene(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
        Sets the Scene for this gesture to the given value. Unregisters previously registered event listeners and registers event listeners for this gesture on the new Scene when the given Scene is not null.
        Parameters:
        scene - The new Scene for this gesture.

      • unregister

        protected abstract void unregister()
        Called when the Scene is removed. You can obtain the old Scene via getScene() so that event handlers can be unregistered.
